alert.note: Alert for Sonoma Coastal Range (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 3:39PM PST until February 24 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THURSDAY TO 11 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, scattered snow showers will continue through mid-afternoon Friday. The snow level will be around 1000 feet, but could reach down to the valley floor. Total snow accumulations up to about 2 inches for elevations above 1500 ft. For the Winter Storm Warning, snow will increase beginning late Thursday afternoon and continue into Friday morning along with locally strong and gusty winds. The snow level will be 1000 to 1500 feet with total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches for elevations above 1500 ft. * WHERE...The Sonoma Coastal Mountain Range. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, 10 AM PST Wednesday through 4 PM PST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Warning, 4 PM PST Thursday through 11 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Slick, snow-covered roads and hiking trails. Hikers, campers, and outdoor enthusiasts may encounter dangerous winter-like conditions above the snow level. Heavier snow showers could produce limited visibilities. Downed trees and power outages possible. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
